thread.title: Late barrage lifts Orlando Solar Bears past Norfolk Admirals
thread.title_full: Late barrage lifts Orlando Solar Bears past Norfolk Admirals | HamptonRoads.com | PilotOnline.com

author: The Virginian-Pilot
title: Late barrage lifts Orlando Solar Bears past Norfolk Admirals
text:
ORLANDO, Fla. Brett Findlay and Brady Vail scored twice apiece, and Orlando broke open a close game with four third-period goals to defeat Norfolk 6-3 on Saturday night.
The teams combined for six goals in the final period. Norfolk's Josh Currie scored at 3:18 of the third to pull the Admirals within 3-2. But Vail scored for Orlando at 7:54 and again at 14:29 to pad Orlando's lead.
Orlando scored on four of its 12 shots in the third period. Norfolk had 20 shots in the final period and 41 for the game.
Jack Rodewald contributed a goal and three assists for the winners.
Currie had two goals and an assist for Norfolk. Greg Chase scored Norfolk's other goal, and Steven Whitney added two assists.
It was Norfolk's third straight loss. At 1-4, the Admirals are in last place in the East Division.
The Admirals will return to Scope on Friday, hosting Quad City.
